ai-ps1.8:1.2_0: “Mendicants, there are these four perversions of perception, mind, and view.
ai-ps1.8:1.8_0: These are the four perversions of perception, mind, and view.
ai-ps1.8:2.1_0: There are these four corrections of perception, mind, and view.
ai-ps1.8:2.7_0: These are the four corrections of perception, mind, and view.”
ai-ps1.8:3.5_0: sentient beings are ruined by wrong view,
ai-ps1.8:4.1_0: Yoked by Māra’s yoke, these people
ai-ps1.8:4.2_0: find no sanctuary from the yoke.
ai-ps1.8:4.4_0: and fare on in birth and death.
ai-ps1.8:5.1_0: But when the Buddhas arise in the world,
ai-ps1.8:5.3_0: they shine a light on this teaching,
ai-ps1.8:5.4_0: that leads to the stilling of suffering.
ai-ps1.8:6.1_0: When a wise person hears them,
ai-ps1.8:8.1_0: A person accomplished in view has given up these four things.”
ai-ps1.8:8.2_0: Whatever has given up, some are not given up,
ai-ps1.8:8.4_0: Happy in suffering arises as a view.
ai-ps1.8:8.6_0: When the mind is ugliness arises, perception arises.
ai-ps1.8:8.8_0: Having given up four-footed worms, there are four kinds of succession:
ai-ps1.8:8.9_0: With there are four kinds of cloth: four blossoms and four distributes,
ai-ps1.8:8.10_0: The account of the Moggallāna’s discussion is finished.
